title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts risks losing $2.36 million in federal funding over sex ed materials deemed 'problematic' by the Trump administration.
The Trump administration issued a demand to remove 'gender ideology' references from Massachusetts' federally funded sex education programs.
Read what Politics The Trump said on September 4, 2025 | 4:39 PM 2 minutes to read The.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão becomes the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC after a successful tenure at Benfica in Portugal.
Patão joined Boston Legacy FC in June and shared her excitement about embracing the challenges of the NWSL.
Inside: the board’s role—and what happens next.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Boston Bruins on October 6, 2024.
Swayman ranked 63rd among qualified goalies with a -9.1 goals saved above expected rate last season.
Understand why Jeremy Swayman feels transformed entering the 2025-26 NHL season with the Bruins.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face the Raiders, his former team, at the Patriots' home opener on Sunday.
After a 9-16 record with the Raiders, McDaniels returns as the Patriots' offensive coordinator.
Next step is scheduled—agenda details inside.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will play Karen Read in a Prime Video series, dividing opinions among more than 250 respondents in a Boston.com poll.
In the informal poll, 48% of readers supported Elizabeth Banks' casting, while 38% expressed a preference for alternative choices.
Two paths are on the table; the trade-offs are laid out inside.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Resort Casino ranked 2nd and 3rd in USA Today's 2025 top non-Vegas casinos list.
Mohegan Sun offers traditional Asian games and was named the number one casino for slots by USA Today.
Travel One could be decisive—why they matter is in the piece.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún Irish music festival at Suffolk Downs features Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues, marking their first U.S. visit in 20+ years.
Tickets range from $75 to $257, with options for lawn, pit, and VIP seating at The Stage at Suffolk Downs.
See the key number ($75) and who it affects.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen faces allegations of creating a toxic work environment, as reported by The Boston Globe.
Incubator members claim they were overcharged and under-supported, questioning the nonprofit's integrity and mission compliance.
Examine the impact of leadership changes on the culture at CommonWealth Kitchen since Jen Faigel took over in 2014.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forty-four proposed Massachusetts ballot questions advance; three questions fail to meet legal requirements.
Signatures from 74,574 registered voters are required by Dec. 3 to proceed to legislative review.
Inside the quote driving pushback—read it in context.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: RFK Jr. faced bipartisan scrutiny at a heated Senate hearing over his COVID-19 vaccine policy changes and agency turmoil.
Senators criticized Kennedy for firing CDC leaders and questioned his stance on vaccines and pandemic mitigation strategies.
One map tells the story—hotspots are shown inside.
